newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin down 12 cents on London's fall, small bids.
newsitem.headline: KL tin down 12 cents on London's fall, small bids.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price fell 12 cents to close at 13.69 ringgit ($5.43) a kg, a new 27-month low, traders said.
The market was pressured by an overnight fall on the London Metal Exchange (LME) and lack of bids, they said.
Traders noted initial bids for only 26 tonnes against offers for 124 tonnes. Final turnover was 104 tonnes, up from 70 on Thursday.
"The market should see some rebound next week but it would depend very much on LME's performance," said one trader. "The London market is weak at the moment."
Buyers were from Japan, Europe and Malaysia, traders said.
The local price premium over LME has narrowed to $35 a tonne from $70 previously, they said.
